columns.text: In this exercise, we are asked to answer the following questions by applying the concept of *Translation Exposure.*
**Exchange rate risk** is the natural consequence in the international market where the value of the *currencies either increase or decrease.*

This exercise is a continuation of the previous exercise. Hence, we will use the same data. We are given the following:

<center>


| | Arrakeen solaris| 
|--|:--:| 
| Assets| 38,000| 
|Liabilities |12,000 | 
| Equity|26,000 | 

 

It is assume that the equity increases by 1,250 solaris due to retained earnings. Hence, the value of the equity will be **27,250**. Consequently, the assets will also increase by 1,250 and will be **39,250**.

In order to determine how would the balance sheet look like, we  will convert the assets, liabilities and equity in U.S. dollar. We will divide their values in solaris by the current exchange rate 1.54 solaris. To visualize: 
$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Value in \$} &= \dfrac{\text{Value in solaris}}{\text{Exchange Rate}}\\[10pt]
\end{aligned}$$

As a conclusion, the balance sheet will have a value of the assets, liabilities and equity of **$25,487.02, $7,792.21, and $17,694.81** respectively. To illustrate: 

$$\begin {array}{c}
\textbf{Atreides International}\\
\textbf{Balance Sheet}\\
\textbf{For the Year Ended 20YX}
\end{array}$$
$$\begin {array}{llr}
\underline{\textbf{Assets:}}\\

\textbf{Total assets}&&\underline{\underline{{\$25,487.02}}}\\
\\
\underline{\textbf{Liabilities and Equity:}}\\
\textbf{Liabilities:}\\
\hspace{10pt}\text{Total Liabilities}&&\text{\$7,792.21}\\
\textbf{Stockholders' Equity:}\\
\hspace{10pt}\text{Total Stockholder's Equity}&&\underline{\text{~17,694.81}}\\
\textbf{Total liabilities and equity}&&\underline{\underline{{\$25,487.02}}}\\

\end{array}$$
